Class SudokuGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • SudokuGame

  • public class SudokuGame
extends java.lang.Object
    The Sudoku Game class, which contains a representation of the board as a 2D array.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SudokuGame(int diff)
      This will create a gameboard of a certain difficulty.
      SudokuGame(int[][] b)
      This will create the game board using a preexisting 2D array.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean checkAll(int[][] b, int row, int col, int val)

      static boolean checkSec(int[][] b, int secRow, int secCol, int val) 
      static int[][] generateBoard(int difficulty)
      Generates a random Sudoku Board and returns it.
      int get(int i, int j)
      Returns the element at row i, column j in the game board.
      int[][] getBoard()
      Returns the 2D array of the game board.
      boolean getChangeable(int row, int col)
      Returns whether the element at row row, column col can be changed.
      void printBoard()
      Prints the board in a user-friendly format.
      void set(int i, int j, int value)
      This will set the element at the row i and the column j in the game board.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SudokuGame

        public SudokuGame(int[][] b)
        This will create the game board using a preexisting 2D array.
        Parameters:
        b - The 2D array representation of the board. Should be 9x9 and contain values 1 - 9.

      • SudokuGame

        public SudokuGame(int diff)
        This will create a gameboard of a certain difficulty.
        Parameters:
        diff - The difficulty of the game. Should be 0 - 2.

        j - The column of the desired element.
